Paste multiple HU values (comma or space separated) to average liver ROIs quickly.

items: CT Liver-Spleen Difference (L-S): >= 0 typically normal; < -10 suggests hepatic steatosis; < -20 often moderate-severe.
CT Liver/Spleen Ratio: < 0.8 suggests steatosis. Liver HU < 40 on noncontrast CT is supportive.
MRI 2-point Dixon estimate: FF < 5% normal; 5-15% mild; 15-30% moderate; > 30% severe. Use vendor PDFF maps if available.
Approximate CT fat fraction shown is a research-derived linear fit from liver-spleen delta; treat as a ballpark, not a clinical PDFF.
